data.title: Cannabis Advisory Committee to Hold Upcoming June Meetings in Los Angeles
data.author: Department of Cannabis Control
data.excerpt: SACRAMENTO – The Bureau of Cannabis Control (Bureau) today announced that the Cannabis Advisory Committee will hold three subcommittee meetings on Thursday, June 27 and a full committee meeting on Friday, June 28 at the Millennium Biltmore Hotel in Los Angeles.

content.rendered:
SACRAMENTO – The Bureau of Cannabis Control (Bureau) today announced that the Cannabis Advisory Committee will hold three subcommittee meetings on Thursday, June 27 and a full committee meeting on Friday, June 28 at the Millennium Biltmore Hotel in Los Angeles.

Meeting Notices and Agendas for these meetings have been posted to the Bureau’s website and can be found at the following link: http://bcc.ca.gov/about_us/committee_meetings.html.

Thursday, June 27, 2019 | 10 a.m.

Subcommittee on Delivery
Millennium Biltmore Hotel – Crystal Ballroom
506 South Grand Avenue
Los Angeles, CA 90071

Subcommittee on Testing Laboratories
Millennium Biltmore Hotel – Tiffany Room
506 South Grand Avenue
Los Angeles, CA 90071

Subcommittee on Equity
Millennium Biltmore Hotel – Heinsbergen Room
506 South Grand Avenue
Los Angeles, CA 90071

Friday, June 28, 2019 | 10 a.m.

Full Committee Meeting
Millennium Biltmore Hotel – Biltmore Bowl
506 South Grand Avenue
Los Angeles, CA 90071

LIVE WEBCAST: The Bureau also plans to webcast the full committee meeting. To view the Cannabis Advisory Committee meeting webcast, visit the following link on June 28: https://thedcapage.blog/webcasts/. (Please note, the three subcommittee meetings on June 27 will not be webcast.)

SEATING LIMITED: Meeting attendees are encouraged to arrive early, as the Bureau cannot guarantee seating in the event the room reaches capacity.

The Cannabis Advisory Committee advises the Bureau and the other licensing authorities – the California Department of Food and Agriculture and the California Department of Public Health – on the development of regulations that help protect public health and safety and reduce the illegal market for cannabis.

To subscribe to email alerts to hear about updates as they become available, please visit the Bureau’s website at http://www.bcc.ca.gov/. For information on all three state licensing authorities, please visit the state’s California Cannabis Portal at https://cannabis.ca.gov/. Follow the Bureau on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for daily news and updates.

Those looking to get in touch with the Bureau of Cannabis Control may contact us directly through email at bcc@dca.ca.gov.

tags: California Department of Food and Agriculture
